page.title: 17CHURCH FARM, CHISELHAMPTON
page.content: Since 1976 Mr.David Thomas has managed this dairy farm for Colonel Hall who bought it in 1962. There are 150 dairy cows and 500 acres of corn needing 2 dairymen and 3 farmworkers. The herd is Freisian,the heifer calves are sold and they retain first option to rebuy them when they are in-calf. Good silage is made,rather then hay. The population of Chiselhampton is around 150, with only the farm and Coach and Horses Inn for employment. Parish Council and community life is linked with Stadhampton. Mr. Thomas represents Col.Hall at N.F.U meetings. He is chairman of the local Y.F.C and belongs to the Farm Managers Association. His day begins at 6.15 a.m. and he starts with office work. He has twice- weekly conferences with Col. Hall.
